analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Bullish bias with medium-to-high conviction. S&P 500 futures establishing new all-time highs, mega-cap tech strength (NVDA, MSFT, META, ORCL) driving year-end rally narrative, and Fed easing supporting risk assets. However, structural weakness in small-caps ($IWM), cryptocurrency pressure ($BTC down 7% YTD), and thin holiday volume create concentration risk and tail downside if liquidity normalizes sharply.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) AI infrastructure monetization and mega-cap tech dominance; (2) Monetary accommodation supporting risk assets despite geopolitical hedging via precious metals; (3) Sector rotation favoring AI-ready technology and utilities over cyclicals, banking, and regulated financials; (4) Year-end consolidation with elevated tail risk.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($690.68): Call Wall $700 (146k OI - active hedging), Put Wall $640 (153k OI - dormant). Max Pain $687. Near support: $670 (45k OI - active), $645 (126k OI - dormant). QQQ ($624.37): Call Wall $630 (33k OI - active), Put Wall $590 (164k OI - dormant). Max Pain $620. Near resistance: $640 (31k OI - active), $625 (29k OI - active). /ES: 6940+ support per Twitter social sentiment.
key_themes: AI infrastructure monetization and mega-cap tech concentration
Monetary accommodation (Fed easing) supporting risk assets
Sector rotation from cyclicals/banking toward AI-ready tech and utilities
Valuation leverage on AI productivity claims and geopolitical hedging via precious metals
Thin holiday volume masking small-cap/crypto weaknessâ€”normalization liquidity risk
risk_factors: Concentration risk: Mega-cap rally (NVDA, MSFT, META, ORCL) masking small-cap ($IWM) and crypto ($BTC) weakness; broad participation deteriorating
Liquidity cliff: Thin holiday volume amplifying moves; early January normalization could trigger sharp reversals in leveraged small-cap/crypto positions
Geopolitical escalation: China-Taiwan tensions, U.S.-China defense contractor sanctions, and geopolitical uncertainty creating safe-haven pressure (metals hedging, bond flows)
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Testing $700 Call Wall (146k OI, active hedging). Support at $670 (45k OI, active). QQQ: Testing $630 Call Wall (33k OI, active) and $625 resistance (29k OI, active). Watch for breakout above $700 SPY or containment; failure to hold $670 SPY intraday would signal weakness into small-cap/crypto pressure zones.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY 1-5 day: Resistance $700 (Call Wall), $730 (5.7% away, dormant), $750 (8.6% away, dormant). Support $670 (active), $645 (6.6% away, dormant), $640 Put Wall. Max Pain gravitational pull: $687. QQQ 1-5 day: Resistance $630 (Call Wall), $640 (2.5% away, active). Support $590 Put Wall (5.5% away, dormant), $585 (6.3% away, dormant). Bullish scenario: SPY 700+ and QQQ 630+ breakouts trigger dealer long hedging; Bearish tail: Thin volume on early January normalization triggers liquidations toward $670 SPY, $625 QQQ.
